### get&#95;execution&#95;seed() {#a8a572c218eb50cd07af7265347c113a8}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>uint64&#95;t llvm::hashing::detail::get&#95;execution&#95;seed ()</>}
  labels = {["inline"]}>
In LLVM&#95;ENABLE&#95;ABI&#95;BREAKING&#95;CHECKS builds, the seed is non-deterministic per process (address of a function in LLVMSupport) to prevent having users depend on the particular hash values.

On platforms without ASLR, this is still likely non-deterministic per build.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/adt/hashing-h/#l00313">313</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/adt/hashing-h">Hashing.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### get&#95;hashable&#95;data() {#a4d42cd18d93c269fe8878db27f2ff8cc}

<MemberDefinition
  template={<>template &lt;typename T&gt;</>}
  prototype={<>std::enable&#95;if&#95;t&lt; is&#95;hashable&#95;data&lt; T &gt;::value, T &gt; llvm::hashing::detail::get&#95;hashable&#95;data (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> T &amp; value)</>}>
Helper to get the hashable data representation for a type.

This variant is enabled when the type itself can be used.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/adt/hashing-h/#l00354">354</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/adt/hashing-h">Hashing.h</a>.

Helper to get the hashable data representation for a type.

This variant is enabled when we must first call hash&#95;value and use the result as our data.

### hash&#95;combine&#95;range&#95;impl() {#a4b425f997c3d2172f7b92a4598332b37}

<MemberDefinition
  template={<>template &lt;typename InputIteratorT&gt;</>}
  prototype={<>hash&#95;code llvm::hashing::detail::hash&#95;combine&#95;range&#95;impl (InputIteratorT first, InputIteratorT last)</>}>
Implement the combining of integral values into a <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/hash-code">hash&#95;code</a>.

This overload is selected when the value type of the iterator is integral. Rather than computing a <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/hash-code">hash&#95;code</a> for each object and then combining them, this (as an optimization) directly combines the integers.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/adt/hashing-h/#l00392">392</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/adt/hashing-h">Hashing.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### hash&#95;combine&#95;range&#95;impl() {#a3978afe88908efc4773a9c2a7796e27b}

<MemberDefinition
  template={<>template &lt;typename ValueT&gt;</>}
  prototype={<>std::enable&#95;if&#95;t&lt; is&#95;hashable&#95;data&lt; ValueT &gt;::value, hash&#95;code &gt; llvm::hashing::detail::hash&#95;combine&#95;range&#95;impl (ValueT &#42; first, ValueT &#42; last)</>}>
Implement the combining of integral values into a <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/hash-code">hash&#95;code</a>.

This overload is selected when the value type of the iterator is integral and when the input iterator is actually a pointer. Rather than computing a <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/hash-code">hash&#95;code</a> for each object and then combining them, this (as an optimization) directly combines the integers. Also, because the integers are stored in contiguous memory, this routine avoids copying each value and directly reads from the underlying memory.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/adt/hashing-h/#l00436">436</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/adt/hashing-h">Hashing.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### hash&#95;integer&#95;value() {#a4fa6656e1c72b2fb9a6ed0659d3e248f}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>hash&#95;code llvm::hashing::detail::hash&#95;integer&#95;value (uint64&#95;t value)</>}
  labels = {["inline"]}>
Helper to hash the value of a single integer.

Overloads for smaller integer types are not provided to ensure consistent behavior in the presence of integral promotions. Essentially, &quot;hash&#95;value(&#39;4&#39;)&quot; and &quot;hash&#95;value(&#39;0&#39; + 4)&quot; should be the same.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/adt/hashing-h/#l00606">606</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/adt/hashing-h">Hashing.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

  labels = {["inline"]}>

</MemberDefinition>

### rotate() {#a4ffb910d18d978660569ea44ac87e494}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>uint64&#95;t llvm::hashing::detail::rotate (uint64&#95;t val, size&#95;t shift)</>}
  labels = {["inline"]}>
Bitwise right rotate.

Normally this will compile to a single instruction, especially if the shift is a manifest constant.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/adt/hashing-h/#l00161">161</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/adt/hashing-h">Hashing.h</a>.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/adt/hashing-h/#l00166">166</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/adt/hashing-h">Hashing.h</a>.

### store&#95;and&#95;advance() {#a0e6505cf45fca2d42d6d02ba7fcde5b8}

<MemberDefinition
  template={<>template &lt;typename T&gt;</>}
  prototype={<>bool llvm::hashing::detail::store&#95;and&#95;advance (char &#42;&amp; buffer_ptr, char &#42; buffer_end, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> T &amp; value, size&#95;t offset=0)</>}>
Helper to store data from a value into a buffer and advance the pointer into that buffer.

This routine first checks whether there is enough space in the provided buffer, and if not immediately returns false. If there is space, it copies the underlying bytes of value into the buffer, advances the buffer&#95;ptr past the copied bytes, and returns true.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/adt/hashing-h/#l00375">375</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/adt/hashing-h">Hashing.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

</SectionDefinition>

<MemberDefinition
